Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewers.toCLI.statusClasses

Class CLILoginViewer

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewers.toCLI.interfaces.CLIStatusViewer
it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewers.toCLI.statusClasses.CLILoginViewer
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpecificStatusViewer
public class CLILoginViewer
extends CLIStatusViewer
Class that represents the CLIStatusViewer Login on the CLI using methods of CLIPrintFunction and ANSIStyle
Author:
Marco
See Also:
CLIStatusViewer, CLIPrintFunction, ANSIStyle

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private boolean checkNicknameResponse​(java.lang.String response)
    Checks if the String is a possible value to set in the executer, then it notifies with a message on standard output if the nickname is correct or not
    private java.lang.String getNicknameResponse()
    Method which prints a little signal to notify on standard output where it is possible to write the nickname then returns the read value if its length is 11 or minus, or its first eight char if it isn't
    void show()
    Uses the private methods of this class to print the nickname's request, to read the nickname and to check it, the if the nickname is't correctly set to executer recalls all private methods in the same order
    private void showNicknameRequest()
    Method which prints the nickname's request using some internal constants to print an little image

    • getNicknameResponse

      private java.lang.String getNicknameResponse()
      Method which prints a little signal to notify on standard output where it is possible to write the nickname then returns the read value if its length is 11 or minus, or its first eight char if it isn't
      Returns:
      String which is read if its length is 11 or minus. its first eleventh chars if it isn't

    • checkNicknameResponse

      private boolean checkNicknameResponse​(java.lang.String response)
      Checks if the String is a possible value to set in the executer, then it notifies with a message on standard output if the nickname is correct or not
      Parameters:
      response - String to represent the nickname
      Returns:
      response is correctly set to executer ? true : false

    • show
